metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10045 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The isMail transport in PHPMailer before 5.2.20 might allow remote attackers to pass extra parameters to the mail command and consequently execute arbitrary code by leveraging improper interaction between the escapeshellarg function and internal escaping performed in the mail function in PHP. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2016-10033.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-10045` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libphp-phpmailer - 5.2.14+dfsg-2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> update from debian resulted in a regression fix (5.2.14+dfsg-2.2)

criterions.comment: libphp-phpmailer package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.14+dfsg-2.1').
